results.title: [MooreToCore] Support for StringType from moore to llvm dialect
results.relevance: Directly addresses StringType conversion in MooreToCore. Discusses how StringType should be handled in module ports and lowering to llvm dialect. Core to the bug's root cause.

results.title: [MooreToCore] Error out on conversions to unsupported types
results.relevance: Specifically addresses assertion failures from dyn_cast when converting to unsupported types. This is the exact issue: failing to check if result type was successfully converted before using it.

results.title: [MooreToCore] Crash with sqrt/floor
results.relevance: Shows a similar crash pattern - assertion failure in dyn_cast during MooreToCore conversion. Different trigger (sqrt/floor) but same root issue: invalid type usage.

results.title: [MooreToCore] Crash when getting values to observe
results.relevance: Another MooreToCore crash, potentially related to type conversion issues.

results.title: [MooreToCore] Properly deal with OOB access in dyn_extract
results.relevance: Related to array indexing and extraction, matches test case feature of array_indexing.

results.title: [ImportVerilog] Support for String Types, String Literals
results.relevance: Related to string type support but in ImportVerilog pass, not MooreToCore conversion.

results.title: [MooreToCore] Support for Unsized Array Type
results.relevance: Related to array type support in MooreToCore conversion.

highest_match.reason: Directly addresses StringType conversion in MooreToCore, discusses module ports and lowering strategy

strong_match.reason: Closed issue that specifically fixed assertion failures from dyn_cast on unsupported types - likely a precursor to this bug

recommendation_notes: Issue #8332 is OPEN and directly related to StringType support in MooreToCore
Issue #9199 was CLOSED with a fix for assertion failures on unsupported type conversions
The current crash in MooreToCore.cpp:259 (getModulePortInfo) appears to be a related but distinct manifestation
This may be a regression or incomplete fix from #9199, or a new variant of the issue
Strong recommendation to review #8332 and #9199 before filing a new issue
